title: The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: The Final Chapter Gets Premiere Date, First-Look Teaser
description: The bizarre story of Natalia Grace will soon come to an end with a final season of ID's infamous documentary series. The post The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: The Final Chapter Gets Premiere Date, First-Look Teaser appeared first on TV Fanatic.
author: Tyler Johnson
excerpt: The bizarre story of Natalia Grace will soon come to an end with a final season of ID's infamous documentary series.
text: Get ready to delve back into the strange saga of Natalia Grace. Investigation Discovery announced today that The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: The Final Chapter will receive its long-awaited premiere in January. Natalia, as you may recall, is the Ukrainian orphan who was accused of trying to murder her adoptive American parents. (Investigation Discovery (YouTube screenshot)) Her story now serves as incontrovertible proof that sometimes, truth is stranger than fiction. In a press release issued today, ID revealed that the new series picks up “After an unprecedented and volatile phone call in which Natalia’s new adoptive family, the Manses, told production, ‘We’re done, we’re done with her.'” According to today’s statement, The Final Chapter “dives back into Natalia’s story as she faces a new set of challenges and upheavals from a dramatic rescue mission to new allegations of abuse.” The series will offer “a conclusion to Natalia’s story as she strives for healing and resolution in her tumultuous journey filled with decades of unexpected twists and turns.” ID also released a chilling teaser that reminds us of just how bonkers this roller coaster ride has been. “Something ain’t right with Natalia. This girl is tweaking,” Antwon Mans tells producers in a voiceover. “I feel like she’s the enemy in the house. And she said to us, we have held her hostage. Made us look like we’re the enemy,” he continues. “She’s done other things too, but this was a new low. Natalia does not have emotions for nothing but herself. We’re done. We’re done with her.” (ID (Youtube Screenshot)) Of course, the case of Natalia Grace has repeatedly proven to be more complicated than it initially appears, and we’re sure this latest installment in the docuseries will only deepen the mystery. Natalia first came to our attention in 2023 with a first season that left viewers wondering if they should feel pity for this adopted child or anger toward this con artist adult. Now, the story will finally come to an end — but something tells us we’ll be left with plenty of questions. Over to you, TV fanatics! Are you ready to reopen this bizarre case, or do you feel like the Natalia Grace saga has run its course? Hit the comments section below to share your thoughts!
html:
Get ready to delve back into the strange saga of Natalia Grace.

Investigation Discovery announced today that The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: The Final Chapter will receive its long-awaited premiere in January.

Natalia, as you may recall, is the Ukrainian orphan who was accused of trying to murder her adoptive American parents.

Her story now serves as incontrovertible proof that sometimes, truth is stranger than fiction.

In a press release issued today, ID revealed that the new series picks up “After an unprecedented and volatile phone call in which Natalia’s new adoptive family, the Manses, told production, ‘We’re done, we’re done with her.'”

According to today’s statement, The Final Chapter “dives back into Natalia’s story as she faces a new set of challenges and upheavals from a dramatic rescue mission to new allegations of abuse.”

The series will offer “a conclusion to Natalia’s story as she strives for healing and resolution in her tumultuous journey filled with decades of unexpected twists and turns.”

ID also released a chilling teaser that reminds us of just how bonkers this roller coaster ride has been.

“Something ain’t right with Natalia. This girl is tweaking,” Antwon Mans tells producers in a voiceover.

“I feel like she’s the enemy in the house. And she said to us, we have held her hostage. Made us look like we’re the enemy,” he continues.

“She’s done other things too, but this was a new low. Natalia does not have emotions for nothing but herself. We’re done. We’re done with her.”

Of course, the case of Natalia Grace has repeatedly proven to be more complicated than it initially appears, and we’re sure this latest installment in the docuseries will only deepen the mystery.

Natalia first came to our attention in 2023 with a first season that left viewers wondering if they should feel pity for this adopted child or anger toward this con artist adult.

Now, the story will finally come to an end — but something tells us we’ll be left with plenty of questions.

Over to you, TV fanatics! Are you ready to reopen this bizarre case, or do you feel like the Natalia Grace saga has run its course?

Hit the comments section below to share your thoughts!
